author: Nerdstalgic
description:
In 2000, the original X-Men movie redefined superhero films, proving comic book adaptations could be more than just campy action flicks. Then, with the success of the first two X-Men films, and the introduction of Christopher Nolan's Batman, the world started to take notice of superhero movies and comic book adaptations.  But then came X-Men: The Last Stand… and it almost destroyed the entire franchise.

💬 What do you think—did The Last Stand deserve all the hate? Let us know in the comments!

🔥 Don’t forget to like, subscribe, and hit the bell for more deep dives into movie history!

#xmen  #marvel  #superheromovies #wolverine
title: How X-Men: The Last Stand Nearly Destroyed the Franchise
